section.heading: Residential parking system in the village of Tuckahoe in the county of Westchester

content.p: the southerly corporate boundary between the village of Tuckahoe\nand the village of Bronxville to Midland Avenue;\n
Midland Avenue to its intersection with Winter Hill Road;\n
Winter Hill Road from its intersection with Midland Avenue to its\nintersection with Main Street;\n

the northerly corporate boundary between the village of Tuckahoe
and the town of Eastchester to the westerly corporate boundary between
the village of Tuckahoe and the city of Yonkers; and

the westerly corporate boundary between the village of Tuckahoe
and the city of Yonkers to the southerly corporate boundary between the
village of Tuckahoe and the village of Bronxville.
 3. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no permit shall be required on those
portions of such streets where the adjacent properties are zoned for
commercial/retail use.
 4. The local law or ordinance providing for such residential parking
system shall:
set forth factors necessitating the enactment of such parking\nsystem;\n
provide the times of the day and days of the week during which\npermit requirements shall be in effect;\n
provide the schedule of fees to be paid for such permits; and\n

provide that such fees shall be credited to the general fund of
the village unless otherwise specified in such local law.
 5. No ordinance shall be adopted pursuant to this section until a
public hearing thereon has been had in the same manner as required for
public hearings on a local law pursuant to the municipal home rule law.
